data.enText: to tell sb about sth, especially in an official way

data.chText: 地址若有变动请随时通知我们。
data.enText: Please inform us of any changes of address.

data.chText: 我得到可靠消息说他们俩明年结婚。
data.enText: I have been reliably informed (= somebody I trust has told me) that the couple will marry next year.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+直接引语

data.enText: to find out information about sth

data.chText: 我们需要时间对这个问题有个透彻的了解。
data.enText: We need time to inform ourselves thoroughly of the problem.
to have an influence on sth

data.chText: 宗教影响着他们生活的各个方面。
data.enText: Religion informs every aspect of their lives.
to give information to the police or sb in authority about the illegal activities of sb
He informed on his own brother.

simple_means.memory_skill: in 使… + form 形式 → 使〔大家知道的〕形式 → 通知

ex.chText: 时间如有变更，我们将尽快通知你们。
ex.enText: We will inform you of any change of time as soon as possible.

ex.chText: 我们很高兴地通知你，你被聘用了。
ex.enText: We are glad to inform you that you have been hired.

ex.chText: 老师会把该学生取得的任何进步都告诉其家长。
ex.enText: The teacher will inform the parents of any progress the pupil has made.

synonyms.bx: 指将事情或信息正式地告知某人。

ex.enText: You need to acquaint me with the truth.

ex.chText: 她得告诉新老板公司近来的动态。
ex.enText: She has to acquaint her new boss with recent happenings in the company.

ex.chText: 她想知道你有哪些长处以及不足。
ex.enText: She wants to acquaint herself with your strengths and weaknesses.

synonyms.bx: 指将某事告知某人，通常用于 acquaint sb with sth 结构。

ex.chText: 如果地址有变，请尽快通知我。
ex.enText: Please notify/inform me of any change of address as soon as possible.

ex.chText: 他们接到通知，说会议被取消了。
ex.enText: They were notified/informed that the meeting was canceled.

synonyms.bx: 指正式地或由官方通知某人某事，常可与 inform 换用。

data.enText: to give information to the police or sb in authority about the illegal activities of sb
He informed on his own brother.

example: The principles that inform modern teaching

tr: impart knowledge of some fact, state or affairs, or event to
example: I informed him of his rights
She had informed on her own parents for years

value.def: If you inform someone of something, you tell them about it.

example.ex: They would inform him of any progress they had made...
example.tran: 他们会把他们取得的任何进步都告诉他。

example.ex: My daughter informed me that she was pregnant...
example.tran: 我女儿告诉我她怀孕了。

example.ex: 'I just added a little soy sauce,' he informs us.
example.tran: “我就加了一点儿酱油,”他告诉我们。

value.def: If someone informs on a person, they give information about the person to the police or another authority, which causes the person to be suspected or proved guilty of doing something bad.

example.ex: Somebody must have informed on us...
Thousands of American citizens have informed on these organized crime syndicates.
example.tran: 数以千计的美国公民检举过这些有组织的犯罪团伙。

value.def: If a situation or activity is informed by an idea or a quality, that idea or quality is very noticeable in it.

example.ex: All great songs are informed by a certain sadness and tension...
example.tran: 所有很棒的歌曲都透着某种悲伤和张力。

example.ex: The concept of the Rose continued to inform the poet's work.
example.tran: 玫瑰的概念持续贯穿于诗人的作品中。

value.tran: 赋(思想或特质)于;渗透入

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to form, shape 形成；形状, 形式
rootsaffixes.title: form

partsOfSpeech.dec: aqui〔= aqu 水〕+ form 形成；形状，形式 → 水状的
con 共同 + form 形成；形状，形式 → 共同的形式 → 使一致
cruci 十字形 + form 形成；形状，形式 → 十字形的
de 坏 + form 形成；形状，形式 → 破坏形状 → 变形
form 形成；形状，形式 + al …的 → 正式的，正规的
form 形成；形状，形式 + al 表名词 + ism 主义 → 形式主义
form 形成；形状，形式 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 形成；培养
form 形成；形状，形式 + ula → 形成的东西 → 公式
formul〔a〕公式；信条 + ate 使… → 使形成公式 → 公式化
in 使… + form 形成；形状，形式 → 使〔大家知道的〕形式 → 通知
in 使 + form 形成；形状，形式 + ative，inform 的形容词 → 情报的；见多识广的
multi 多 + form 形成；形状，形式 → 多形状的
per 假 + form 形成；形状，形式 → 假形式 → 表演
re 一再 + form 形成；形状，形式 → 重新形成 → 改造
trans 变换 + form 形成；形状，形式 → 变形；改造
uni 一个 + form 形成；形状，形式 → 一种形状 → 一致的
